title: Neil Jones insists he wasn't laughing at ex Katya's fall on Strictly
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Katya Jones suffered what is sure to be every dancer’s worst nightmare after falling not once, but twice, during this weekend’s Strictly Come Dancing, but her ex Neil Jones has insisted he wasn’t laughing at her misfortune on the show.

Katya was performing to The Weather Girls’ It’s Raining Men with her dance partner Mike Bushell for the show’s movie-themed week, when she took a tumble during the routine, only to fall over again at the top of the stairs after receiving her scores from the judges.

Advertisement

Advertisement

Falling over twice in such a short space of time obviously caused a few giggles in the studio, but Neil Jones – who is performing in this year’s series alongside former England footballer Alex Scott – has insisted that no-one was laughing at Katya, instead claiming that her second fall was just a bit of a joke all along that all of the cast were in on.

‘So every is clear, no one was [laughing] at @mrs_katjones fall on Saturday,’ Neil wrote about his ex-wife Katya on Twitter.

‘We were [laughing] at the fact she styled it out and still made @mikebreakfast finish the routine and then we all said [she should] fall when she got into Claudia’s area so she did as a joke and that’s why we were [laughing] again…’

It all makes *a little* more sense now…

Apparently Katya’s second fall was just ‘a joke’…

Katya and Neil shared the news of their split earlier in August this year after being married for six years.

Sharing the same statement on Instagram the pair said: ‘As our fans and loyal supporters you are really important to us and so we wanted to let you know some news. After 11 years, we have made the mutual decision to separate.

‘We will always love each other, just in a different way as friends. This will never change what a great team we make and we are really proud of everything we have achieved together.

‘Our shared love of dance means we will keep working and dancing together as well as exploring different individual projects.

Katya and Mike performed a Magic Mike themed dance on this week’s show. (PA)

‘No matter what we do we will always support and respect each other.’

Advertisement

Advertisement

Though Katya seemed quite unsteady on her feet during this week’s show, tweeting after the performance she denied being ‘drunk’ and also said the second fall was staged.

‘Guys! I’m totally fine! No idea what happened. So sorry. But so proud of @mikebreakfast for carrying on and delivering “the dolphin”!’ she wrote.

Katya and Mike scored 18 points from the judges for their routine, which saw journalist Mike sliding down a pole in a fireman’s outfit, before ripping it off the reveal his glittery costume underneath, making it a memorable performance in a variety of ways.

Strictly Come Dancing returns Saturday at 6.40 on BBC One.
